cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SE of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward southeast Louisiana then curving north into Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near the Mouth of the Mississippi River/Port Fourchon area

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron, LA to west of Intracoastal City, LA and Mouth of Pearl River to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from eastern Texas to the Mississippi/Alabama border, especially southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely with a 67% chance of 50-kt (58 mph) winds and a 21% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds at the port; peak gusts 70-80 mph possible late Sunday into early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft possible along the lower Mississippi River and connected lakes (Maurepas/Pontchartrain) that influence the Baton Rouge reach.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated 20 inch totals possible, producing significant flash and river flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes Sunday–Monday; prolonged riverine flooding on the Mississippi River could impede navigation and dockside operations.
